channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Red Bow Month
item.description:
Sunday, 1 March 2026

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support Red Bow Month

Red Bow Month is a statewide awareness and fundraising campaign that builds community understanding of muscular dystrophy and the daily impact of neuromuscular conditions on individuals and families. Throughout the month, landmarks, schools, workplaces and community groups are encouraged to show their support, start conversations and get involved

This Light Up is organised by: MS Queensland

Light up asset: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Citizenship Ceremony
item.description:
Monday, 2 March 2026

City Hall will be lit Green and Gold to celebrate a Citizenship Ceremony

Citizenship ceremonies are an important opportunity to welcome new citizens formally as full members of the Australian community

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome Awareness Week
item.description:
Tuesday, 3 March 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome Awareness Week

The purpose of this national event is to raise awareness around Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome. To find better support options, treatments and a cure for patients living with Bone Marrow Failure Syndrome and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: Maddie Reiwoltd's Vision

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.description:

Story Bridge will be lit Red and Yellow to support Red and Yellow Day - Surf Life Saving Awareness

March 4th will be the very first national Red and Yellow Day - an awareness day to raise the profile of lifesaving, water safety and supporting the red and yellow community.

This Light Up is organised by: Surf Life Saving Queensland

item.title: Alliance Fracaise French Film Festival
item.description:
Thursday, 5 March 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Blue to celebrate the Alliance Fracaise French Film Festival

The Alliance Francaise French Film Festival, is the most important celebration of French Cinema outside of France, with a purpose to showcase the best of French films to the Australian audience. It also constitutes an important element of the international cultural offer in Australia, including in Brisbane

This Light Up is organised by: Alliance Francaise de Brisbane

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: 2026 Shine a Light on Lymphoedema
item.description:
Friday, 6 March 2026

City Hall will be lit Blue to support 2026 Shine a Light on Lymphoedema

World Lymphoedema Day is on the 6th March 2026, and the month of March is used to raise awareness of the chronic condition of lymphoedema. Lymphoedema is an accumulation of fluid with subsequent swelling and heaviness of parts of the body due to a breakdown in the lymphatic system. It can occur after cancer, or as the result of trauma or a genetic predisposition. It's more than just a physical condition as it can be debilitating and disfiguring, affecting people both emotionally and psychologically. It is conservatively estimated that around 70,000 people in Australia are living with lymphoedema.

This Light Up is organised by: Lymphoedema Association Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

World Lymphoedema Day is on the 6th March 2026, and the month of March is used to raise awareness of the chronic condition of lymphoedema. Lymphoedema is an accumulation of fluid with subsequent swelling and heaviness of parts of the body due to a breakdown in the lymphatic system. It can occur after cancer, or as the result of trauma or a genetic predisposition. It's more than just a physical condition as it can be debilitating and disfiguring, affecting people both emotionally and psychologically. It is conservatively estimated that around 70,000 people in Australia are living with lymphoedema.
This Light Up is organised by: Lymphoedema Association Australia
item.x-trumba:customfield: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: International Women's Day
item.description:
Sunday, 8 March 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to celebrate International Women's Day

International Women's Day is celebrated on the 8th March, as part of Queensland Women's Week. Queensland Women's Week (QWW) recognises and celebrates the successes and achievements of women and girls across Queensland. It's a time to acknowledge that everyone has a role to play in creating a Queensland community that respects women, embraces gender equality, and promotes and protects the rights, interests and wellbeing of women and girls. By doing this, we enrich and strengthen our communities and create a more equal Queensland where everyone is valued.

This Light Up is organised by: The Office for Women, Department for Women and Women's Economic Security

item.title: Take to the Skies - RFDS Giving Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 11 March 2026

City Hall will be lit Blue White Red to support Take to the Skies - RFDS Giving Day

The RFDS QLD is bringing their work into the heart of Brisbane, giving locals the chance to learn about the lifesaving care we provide across the state and to support communities in regional, rural and remote Queensland. It aims to inspire generosity, build awareness and bring people together to help the Flying Doctor continue delivering vital healthcare wherever it's needed most. Event held at King George Square

This Light Up is organised by: Royal Flying Doctor Service (Queensland section)

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: World Kidney Day
item.description:
Thursday, 12 March 2026

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support World Kidney Day

World Kidney Day is 12th March, 2026 with this year's theme, Kidney Health for All – Caring for People, Protecting the Planet. This highlights the importance of ensuring equitable access to kidney care while promoting healthier lifestyles and a more sustainable futurek. Given that 1.8 million Australians have kidney disease and don’t know about it, raising awareness is therefore vital to ensure everyone talks to their GP about their Kidney Health.

This Light Up is organised by: Kidney Health Australia

City Hall will be lit Red to support World Kidney Day

World Kidney Day is 12th March, 2026 with this year's theme, Kidney Health for All – Caring for People, Protecting the Planet. This highlights the importance of ensuring equitable access to kidney care while promoting healthier lifestyles and a more sustainable futurek. Given that 1.8 million Australians have kidney disease and don’t know about it, raising awareness is therefore vital to ensure everyone talks to their GP about their Kidney Health.

This Light Up is organised by: Kidney Health Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

item.title: Long Covid Awareness Day
item.description:
Friday, 13 March 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Teal to support Long Covid Awareness Day

Long Covid Foundation is a non-profit organization and ILCA a grassroots awareness group dedicated to improving the lives of those affected by Long COVID and others touched by the ongoing COVID Pandemic. Our teams work to provide support, resources, and direct action to make a difference in the lives of those suffering. By Lighting assets and landmarks ahead of Internatioanl Long Covid Awareness Day on March 15th, it shows those battling Long COVID know that they are not alone. They will be reminded that people are working for a cure while raising awareness about the impacts of Long COVID. 100s of millions of people suffer with Long COVID worldwide and it is a disabling illness with a complex list of more than 200 symptoms, resulting from a SARS-CoV-2 infection. These debilitating symptoms can last for weeks, months, or years and can be fatal.

This Light Up is organised by: Long Covid Foundation

Light up asset: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: St Patrick's Day Parade
item.description:
Saturday, 14 March 2026

Victoria Bridge will be lit Green to celebrate the St Patrick's Day Parade

The Brisbane Irish Festival is a long-standing annual event that promotes and celebrates the occasion of St Patrick’s Day, Irish culture and its contribution to the state of Queensland. This year the festival brings events, concerts and gatherings to embrace the ‘Gaelige – The language of Ireland (Teanga na hÉireann)’ theme. Come and join us as we paint the town green again on Saturday 14th March 2026 for the St Patrick’s Day Parade. Brisbane, get ready to wear the green and celebrate all things Irish!

This Light Up is organised by: St Patrick's Day Parade Committee

Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.title: Squash Australian Open
item.description:
Sunday, 15 March 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green and Gold to celebrate the Squash Australian Open

The Squash Australian Open is a Professional Squash Association (PSA) World Tour Gold Event that brings together the world's top squash players to compete for the title of Australian Open Champion. Hosted in Brisbane in 2026, this exciting tournament showcases high-level squash action as elite athletes battle for glory on one of the sport's biggest stages.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Neurodiversity Celebration Week - 2026
item.description:
Monday, 16 March 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours to celebrate the Neurodiversity Celebration Week - 2026

Neurodiversity Celebration Week is being held 17-23 March. The awareness week is a worldwide initiative that challenges stereotypes and misconceptions about neurological differences. It aims to transform how neurodivergent individuals are perceived and celebrate theed by providing schools, universities, organisations, and others around the world with the opportunity to recognise the many skills and talents of neurodivergent individuals, while creating more inclusive and equitable cultures that celebrate differences and empower every individual.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council - BrisAbility

Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Neurodiversity Celebration Week is being held 16-22 March. The awareness week is a worldwide initiative that challenges stereotypes and misconceptions about neurological differences. It aims to transform how neurodivergent individuals are perceived and celebrate theed by providing schools, universities, organisations, and others around the world with the opportunity to recognise the many skills and talents of neurodivergent individuals, while creating more inclusive and equitable cultures that celebrate differences and empower every individual.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council - BrisAbility

item.title: Harmony Day
item.description:
Saturday, 21 March 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Orange to celebrate Harmony Day

Harmony Day is celebrated annually on 21 March in Australia. Harmony Day began in 1999, coinciding with the United Nations International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination. The message of Harmony Day is social cohesion and racial harmony, and it is expressed through community participation, inclusiveness, celebrating diversity, respect and belonging

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: Epic Walk for DV
item.description:
Sunday, 22 March 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Purple to support the Epic Walk for DV

Join the Epic Walk for DV on Sunday 22 March 2026, the 5th year of the event. Come and join the sea of purple to take a stand against domestic violence with a 5km walk held in New Farm Park, Brisbane. The Epic Walk for DV will help raise awareness and vital funds for the lifechanging and lifesaving services provided by Women's Legal Service Qld (WLSQ).

This Light Up is organised by: Women's Legal Service

item.title: World TB Day
item.description:
Sunday, 22 March 2026

City Hall will be lit Red to support World TB Day

Tuberculosis is the world's biggest infectious disease killer, with over 10 million people diagnosed with tuberculosis and more than 1.2 million deaths each year. We are reaching out to iconic buildings and landmarks around Australia, asking them to illuminate their facades in red on this day to show solidarity in the fight against tuberculosis and raise awareness about this ongoing global health challenge. Results International (Australia) is a non-partisan international aid and development organisation. We advocate directly to Australian Parliamentarians with the aim of leveraging millions of dollars in Government funding for the world's poorest communities. We believe that no matter where people are born, everyone should have equal opportunities to fulfil their potential in life.

This Light Up is organised by: Results Australia

Light up asset: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Library, Light up asset

We advocate directly to Australian Parliamentarians with the aim of leveraging millions of dollars in Government funding for the world's poorest communities. We believe that no matter where people are born, everyone should have equal opportunities to fulfil their potential in life.
This Light Up is organised by: Results Australia
item.x-trumba:customfield: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: National Sunflower Day
item.description:
Monday, 23 March 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Yellow to support National Sunflower Day

National Sunflower Day illuminates Australia in a vibrant yellow glow, symbolising hope, awareness, and the urgent need for funding and support for scleroderma. By lighting up iconic landmarks, trees and businesses across the country, we aim to: Increase Awareness: Scleroderma is often misdiagnosed and misunderstood. National Sunflower Day brings this hidden disease into the spotlight, educating the public about its impact and the challenges faced by those living with it. Unlike other conditions, scleroderma often lacks dedicated nursing support. Your Sunflower Day donation helps us change that by funding specialist nurses who provide essential care and guidance to those in need.

This Light Up is organised by: Scleroderma Australia Inc

Light up asset: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City

item.title: AusCycling Track National Championships
item.description:
Tuesday, 24 March 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will be lit Green and Gold to celebrate AusCycling Track National Championships

AusCycling, the trading name of the AusCycling Limited, is the national governing body for cycling in Australia, and represents the interests of affiliated cycling clubs and its individual members.
The Track National Championships are the biggest domestic track event in the country and are returning to Brisbane in March and April 2026.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Eve of World Myeloma Day
item.description:
Wednesday, 25 March 2026

Victoria Bridge will be lit Red to support Eve of World Myeloma Day

March is Myeloma Awareness Month and Thursday 26th March 2026 is recognized globally as World Myeloma Day.
Myeloma is an incurable blood cancer that affects 22,000 Australians. Myeloma Australia provides free support services and education to people diagnosed with myeloma, their family and friends as well healthcare professionals.

This Light Up is organised by: Myeloma Australia

item.title: Make March Purple for Epilepsy
item.description:
Thursday, 26 March 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support Make March Purple for Epilepsy

For over 50 years, Epilepsy Queensland has been working towards a Queensland that prioritises brain health, bringing hope to people with epilepsy. Around 50,000 Queenslanders have an epilepsy diagnosis - the most common chronic brain disease and a condition that affects people of all ages and demographics.

This Light Up is organised by: Epilepsy Queensland

item.title: Earth Hour
item.description:
Saturday, 28 March 2026

Kangaroo Point Bridge will have Lights Off for one hour to support Earth Hour

Earth Hour is a global environmental movement that began in Sydney in 2007 and has grown to become the world’s largest grassroots campaign for the environment, with participation from more than 190 countries and territories each year. The purpose of the Earth Hour Switch Off campaign is to raise awareness of the urgent challenges facing our planet, including climate change and biodiversity loss, and to inspire collective action to protect nature. The iconic switch off at 8:30pm local time is a symbolic moment that demonstrates public support for the environment and it brings greater awareness to the issue and demonstrates commitment to help protect the planet, both during and beyond Earth Hour.

This Light Up is organised by: WWF Australia

Venue address: Kangaroo Point Bridge, Scott Street, Kangaroo Point
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

Earth Hour is a global environmental movement that began in Sydney in 2007 and has grown to become the world’s largest grassroots campaign for the environment, with participation from more than 190 countries and territories each year. The purpose of the Earth Hour Switch Off campaign is to raise awareness of the urgent challenges facing our planet, including climate change and biodiversity loss, and to inspire collective action to protect nature. The iconic switch off at 8:30pm local time is a symbolic moment that demonstrates public support for the environment and it brings greater awareness to the issue and demonstrates commitment to help protect the planet, both during and beyond Earth Hour.

This Light Up is organised by: WWF Australia

Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset

item.description:
Saturday, 28 March 2026

Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate Run Army

Run Army’s mission is to promotes health, fitness and wellbeing through running celebrate programs and a nation‐wide event; to fulfil our commitment to the wellbeing of our people and the community. Our combined efforts will unite all those who serve the community in uniform as we collectively strive for health and wellbeing and care for our veterans and their families.

This Light Up is organised by: NX Sports Community Foundation Limited

item.title: Brisbane Cycling Festival
item.description:
Monday, 30 March 2026

Victoria Bridge will be lit Pink Green Light Blue Orange Purple to celebrate the Brisbane Cycling Festival

The Brisbane Cycling Festival is an initiative of AusCycling - the national sporting organisation responsible for the development, growth and facilitation of all forms of cycling and riding in Australia.
Australia’s largest multi-disciplinary cycling event returns over six massive weeks delivering an action-packed month of events, races, rides, expo’s and more.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

item.title: Trans Day of Visibility
item.description:
Tuesday, 31 March 2026

Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue White Pink to celebrate Trans Day of Visibility

Trans Day of Visibility (TDOV) is an annual international celebration of trans pride and awareness, that is dedicated to celebrating Transgender and Gender Diverse communities and raising awareness of the stigma and discrimination faced. In addition to this, the purpose of the day is also to celebrate our communities by being visible and proud.

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice/ Qld Aids Council

Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue type: General Council venue, Light up asset
